p.s: Description of Brochothrix campestris sp. nov.
Brochothrix campestris (cam.pes'tris. L.n. campestris from the fields)
Gram positive, catalase positive, nonmotile, nonsporeforming.
In 24-h cultures cells are a mixture oflong and short rods which usually occur singly or in pairs.
Colonies are circular, not pigmented, and 0.7 to 1 mm diameter after 48 h of incubation on APT agar.
Growth occurs at 4 and 24°C but not at 37°C.
No growth occurs at pH 3.9, on acetate agar, with 10% NaCl, or with 0.05% potassium tellurite.
Facultatively anaerobic; homofermentative with production principally of L-(+)-lactic acid.
Acid but no gas is produced from glycerol, ribose, D-fructose, D-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, salicin, maltose, trehalose, rhamnose, amygdalin, arbutin, and D-cellobiose.
Methyl red and Voges-Proskauer positive.
H2S and indole are not produced, sodium hippurate and esculin are hydrolyzed, nitrate is not reduced, and gelatin is not liquefied.
Exogenous urea and citrate are not utilized.
The cell wall contains rneso-diaminopimelic acid.
The G+C content of the DNA is 38 mol%.
Isolated from soil or grass.
The type strain is strain S3 (= CIP 102920 = ATCC 43754).
Description of the type strain.
Strain S3T has all of the properties given above for the species.
In addition, strain S3T grows with 8% NaCl after 6 days of incubation.
It ferments D-mannitol and gentobiose, but not inositol, sucrose, or D-tagatose, and it is colistin susceptible.
Isolated from soil in
France.
